about.sajuStrength: Strength: Long-term theme transitions, energy balance
about.sajuAccuracy: Accuracy: Birth time and solar term correction
about.sajuDetail: Hour pillar changes can affect personality and timing. Solar term boundaries and local time corrections are important.
about.astroDesc: Reads planets, signs, houses, and aspects in birth charts, with transits/returns for timing.
about.astroDetail: Even 5-15 minute errors can change ASC/houses. Hospital records + DST reflection recommended.
about.ichingDesc: Captures current flow and transition points with 64 hexagram symbolic language.
about.ichingStrength: Strength: Directional hints at decision crossroads
about.ichingAccuracy: Accuracy: Question quality and context clarity
about.ichingDetail: Open questions yield clearer advice than 'yes/no' questions.
about.tarotDesc: Reveals current psychological and relationship patterns with symbolic cards, providing immediate action guidance.
about.tarotAccuracy: Accuracy: Question specificity, spread, reroll strategy
about.tarotDetail: Same card can mean different things by context/position. View with action scenarios.

faq.a1: Yes, you can cancel your subscription anytime. You'll continue to have access until the end of your billing period.

faq.title: Frequently Asked Questions
faq.subtitle: Find answers to common questions below
faq.footer: Still have questions? Contact us through the Contact page.
faq.a1: DestinyPal is an AI-powered platform that combines multiple divination systems including Astrology, Saju (Four Pillars), Tarot, I Ching, Dream Interpretation, and Numerology to provide personalized insights.
faq.a2: Yes! Basic features are free to use. Premium features like detailed AI consultations and unlimited readings are available through our subscription plans.
faq.a3: Our readings use traditional divination principles combined with AI analysis. They are for entertainment and self-reflection purposes, not professional advice. Accuracy depends on the quality of input information.
faq.q4: Do I need to know my birth time?
faq.a4: For Saju and detailed Astrology readings, knowing your exact birth time gives more accurate results. However, many features work without it.
faq.a5: Yes. We use industry-standard encryption and security measures. We do not sell your personal information. See our Privacy Policy for details.
faq.q6: Can I cancel my subscription anytime?
faq.a6: Yes, you can cancel your subscription anytime from your account settings. You'll continue to have access until the end of your billing period.
faq.a7: Currently we support Korean and English.

q1_energy_network.text: After a day full of people and meetings, you:

options.A: Feel charged and want to keep going.
options.C: Depends on my mood that day.

q2_energy_weekend.text: On a long weekend, you prefer to:

options.C: Mix of both - some plans, some free time.

q3_energy_spontaneous.text: When invited to a sudden gathering, you usually:

options.B: Pause and decide after some thought.
options.C: Check who else is going first.

q4_energy_transit.text: During travel/wait times, you tend to:

options.A: Chat and engage with people around you.
options.B: Use headphones and stay in your own zone.
A few set activities + ample solo time.

q21_energy_focus.text: In long work sessions, you recharge more by:

options.B: Staying in your own lane with minimal breaks.

options.C: Fine if scheduled, annoying if random.

q24_energy_events.text: At large events, you tend to:

options.A: Work the room and meet many.
options.B: Stay with a few or observe quietly.
options.C: Focus on the event content itself.

q6_cog_problem.text: Facing a new problem, you first:

q7_cog_explain.text: When learning, you prefer explanations that start with:

q8_cog_evaluate.text: Evaluating an idea, you lean toward:

q9_cog_basis.text: Decisions feel solid when they are built on:

options.A: Retool the concept to fit the future.
options.B: Re-sequence the plan to fit realities.

q26_cog_detail_bigpicture.text: You are more satisfied when work outputs are:

q27_cog_rule_break.text: If a process slows you down, you:

options.A: Find a new pattern or shortcut.
options.B: Refine existing steps within the rules.
options.C: Propose changes to the process officially.

q28_cog_metrics_story.text: Persuasion works best on you via:

q30_cog_changecomfort.text: When requirements change midstream, you feel:

options.B: Prefer to lock scope and avoid churn.
options.C: Accept it as part of the process.

q11_decision_conflict.text: In a team conflict, you focus first on:

q14_decision_rules.text: Catching a rule break, you believe:

options.C: Depends on intent behind the action.

q15_decision_delay.text: If you postpone a decision, it is usually because:

options.C: Waiting for external factors to clarify.

q31_decision_dataemotion.text: To reach a decision, you weigh more:

options.A: Take it if logic checks out.

options.C: Keep it yourself if stakes are high.

options.A: Drive to a fast, logical resolution.
options.B: Slow down to cool emotions and align.
Surge near the end under pressure.

options.C: Go with the flow, see what happens.

q20_rhythm_feeling.text: When plans break, you mostly feel:

options.A: Early day; you like to start strong.
options.B: Later day; you ramp up gradually.
options.C: Varies by day, no fixed pattern.
Don't plan much, react to priorities.

options.B: Use it to rest or tidy planned work.
